name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: "As the briefing was beginning to wrap up, Trump looked at me and made unsolicited disparaging remarks about human sources. 'Anyone will say anything if you pay them enough. I know that,  and you know that,' he said.”

An excerpt from @JohnBrennan’s book: https://t.co/DVwsc8b0VA

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: H.R. McMaster, Trump's former national security adviser, on POTUS debate response to question about condemning white nationalists: "No leader should encourage any group that is based on a narrow identity that aims to supersede our identity as Americans." https://t.co/6CURwVcqb3

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Donald Trump once again refused to condemn white-supremacist groups outright. The threat of far-right violence isn’t going away. Then: An overlooked variable is key to understanding the pandemic. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/H56z19z3ED

name: TheAtlantic
text: In an exclusive interview with @IsaacDovere, former CIA Director John Brennan answers some of the lingering questions about Trump and Putin: https://t.co/nnjAXuPka6

name: TheAtlantic
text: Read an excerpt from Brennan’s book, shared exclusively with The Atlantic: “I had serious doubts that Trump would protect our nation’s most vital secrets.” https://t.co/x2QoYvENQC

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdamHSays: .@PeterAtlantic: Do white-supremacist groups pose a national-security threat to the United States, and should the president condemn them more clearly and directly than he has to date?

H.R. McMaster: Yes and yes.

https://t.co/FTtmWTo80w https://t.co/kF9pB1ooVn

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If polls prove accurate, America will be among the rare major democracies in recent memory to throw a populist out of office at the end of his first term," @Yascha_Mounk writes: https://t.co/lv3EutfTJW

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Condemning white supremacists should be a layup for any leader,” former National Security Adviser H. R. McMaster told @PeterAtlantic of Trump’s refusal to denounce far-right groups. https://t.co/aYjwzjvdnv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Related: Read former CIA Director John Brennan’s exclusive interview with @IsaacDovere: “I find it difficult to explain the extent to which Donald Trump has kowtowed” to Putin, Brennan says. https://t.co/QYnVQXDRz0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sonnie Hereford IV desegregated Alabama’s public schools in 1963. He was only 6 years old. One of five pieces from our special project #TheFirsts, by @AdamHSays: https://t.co/Ad8UGAWMTT
